items.description: The tanto evolved as a combat weapon to become a more ornate decoration worn by the higher class.
items.name: 小短刀

items.description: A 'pocket sword' often carried by samurai or their wives for daily use, as well as suicide by cutting the throat to avoid capture.
items.name: 懐剣

items.description: A 'pocket sword' often carried by samurai or their wives for daily use, as well as suicide by cutting the throat to avoid capture.
items.name: 懐剣

items.description: The tanto evolved as a combat weapon to become a more ornate decoration worn by the higher class.
items.name: 小短刀

items.description: The tanto was very useful in combat against armored enemies, where within grapple distance, it could be used as a finishing weapon.
items.name: 合口

items.description: The tanto was very useful in combat against armored enemies, where within grapple distance, it could be used as a finishing weapon.
items.name: 合口

items.description: The tanto was mainly carried by samurai and often paired with a tachi and was great for thrusting.
items.name: 短刀

items.description: The tanto was mainly carried by samurai and often paired with a tachi and was great for thrusting.
items.name: 短刀

items.description: Forged by Kagemitsu and worn extensively by warlord Uesugi Kenshin. The characters on the blade read 'Chichibu Daibosatsu,' referring to the shrine it was offered to.
items.name: 謙信景光

items.description: Forged by Kagemitsu and worn extensively by warlord Uesugi Kenshin. The characters on the blade read 'Chichibu Daibosatsu,' referring to the shrine it was offered to.
items.name: 謙信景光

items.description: A well crafted wakizashi forged by Sadamune with his signatured marked on the blade.
items.name: 物吉貞宗

items.description: A well crafted wakizashi forged by Sadamune with his signatured marked on the blade.
items.name: 物吉貞宗

items.description: Unlike other weapons, the wakizashi was only permitted to be worn by samurai alongside a katana, as the pair represented high status.
items.name: 小脇差

items.description: Unlike other weapons, the wakizashi was only permitted to be worn by samurai alongside a katana, as the pair represented high status.
items.name: 小脇差

items.description: A companion weapon worn with the katana, used to behead corpses as well as for ritual suicide via disembowelment.
items.name: 脇差

items.description: A companion weapon worn with the katana, used to behead corpses as well as for ritual suicide via disembowelment.
items.name: 脇差

items.description: Being smaller and swifter than the katana, the wakizashi was sometimes used for indoor combat.
items.name: 新刀脇差

items.description: Being smaller and swifter than the katana, the wakizashi was sometimes used for indoor combat.
items.name: 新刀脇差

items.description: A shorter than average sword, making the draw speed incredibly fast in exchange for reach. Some shorter swordsmen prefered the length.
items.name: 小さ刀

items.description: A shorter than average sword, making the draw speed incredibly fast in exchange for reach. Some shorter swordsmen prefered the length.
items.name: 小さ刀

items.description: A ko-katana famously worm by Ashikaga Takauji. The name translates to 'Bone Feaster' as its strikes were said to easily cut through bone.
items.name: 骨喰藤四郎

items.description: A ko-katana famously worm by Ashikaga Takauji. The name translates to 'Bone Feaster' as its strikes were said to easily cut through bone.
items.name: 骨喰藤四郎

items.description: A shinobi sword with an unmarked blade. Unlike the katana, it's straightened to improve stabbing ability for assassinations.
items.name: 忍者剣

items.description: A shinobi sword with an unmarked blade. Unlike the katana, it's straightened to improve stabbing ability for assassinations.
items.name: 忍者剣

items.description: An uchigatana shorted to assist in iaido, the art of drawing and striking in the same motion.
items.name: 抜き打ち刀

items.description: An uchigatana shorted to assist in iaido, the art of drawing and striking in the same motion.
items.name: 抜き打ち刀

items.description: A katana without a tsuba, originally crafted to be worn easier with armor, it became popular among the upperclass.
items.name: 合口拵の刀

items.description: A katana without a tsuba, originally crafted to be worn easier with armor, it became popular among the upperclass.
items.name: 合口拵の刀

items.description: A legendary sword forged by the master swordsmith Senji Muramasa from Kuwana in Ise Province.
items.name: 勢州桑名住村正

items.description: A legendary sword forged by the master swordsmith Senji Muramasa from Kuwana in Ise Province.
items.name: 勢州桑名住村正

items.description: A modern katana with a bo-hi or fuller, decreasing the weight of the blade without compromising integrity.
items.name: 新刀

items.description: A modern katana with a bo-hi or fuller, decreasing the weight of the blade without compromising integrity.
items.name: 新刀

items.description: A rare Hattori Hanzo blade preserved in a black shirasaya. Owned by O-Ren and decorated with sakura blossoms, it was rarely used due to the extremely high quality.
items.name: オーレンの白鞘

items.description: A rare Hattori Hanzo blade preserved in a black shirasaya. Owned by O-Ren and decorated with sakura blossoms, it was rarely used due to the extremely high quality.
items.name: オーレンの白鞘

items.description: Not a katana but a katana blade stored within a wooden case, and thus, was not meant to be used as a weapon.
items.name: 白鞘の刃

items.description: Not a katana but a katana blade stored within a wooden case, and thus, was not meant to be used as a weapon.
items.name: 白鞘

items.description: A masterwork blade with astonishing craftmanship from school of Sue Bizen, created in the Bunmei era of Japan.
items.name: 末備前刀

items.description: A masterwork blade with astonishing craftmanship from school of Sue Bizen, created in the Bunmei era of Japan.
items.name: 末備前の鞘

items.description: Forged by Kanesada and owned by a cruel warlord Hosokawa Tadaoki, this sword was said to have executed 36 of his vassals.
items.name: 歌仙兼定

items.description: Forged by Kanesada and owned by a cruel warlord Hosokawa Tadaoki, this sword was said to have executed 36 of his vassals.
items.name: 歌仙兼定

items.description: The uchigatana was created after the tachi and before the katana as a shorter, easy to make sword, though it often wasn't of the best quality.
items.name: 腰刀

items.description: The uchigatana was created after the tachi and before the katana as a shorter, easy to make sword, though it often wasn't of the best quality.
items.name: 腰刀

items.description: The steel used in katanas was prone to rust, a process greatly accelerated if the blood was not cleaned from it.
items.name: 錆びた刀

items.description: The steel used in katanas was prone to rust, a process greatly accelerated if the blood was not cleaned from it.
items.name: 錆びた刀

items.description: A katana forged in Seki, Mine province. With a more shallow curve than the uchigatana, the katana is suited well for both thrusting and slashing.
items.name: 関の刀

items.description: A katana forged in Seki, Mine province. With a more shallow curve than the uchigatana, the katana is suited well for both thrusting and slashing.
items.name: 関の刀

items.description: A footsoldier's sword, preferred over the tachi as smaller, cheaper but still formitable sword.
items.name: 足軽の打刀

items.description: A footsoldier's sword, preferred over the tachi as smaller, cheaper but still formitable sword.
items.name: 足軽の打刀

items.description: A katana formerly owned by Ishida Mitsunari, forged by legendary swordsmith Masamune.
items.name: 石田正宗

items.description: A katana formerly owned by Ishida Mitsunari, forged by legendary swordsmith Masamune.
items.name: 石田正宗

items.description: The sword owned by Beatrix Kiddo and forged by Hattori Hanzo as his greatest creation.
items.name: ザ・ブライドの剣

items.description: The sword owned by Beatrix Kiddo and forged by Hattori Hanzo as his greatest creation.
items.name: ザ・ブライドの剣

items.description: A katana with a high quality blade tempered to last longer through wear and tear.
items.name: モッコー・カタナ

items.description: A katana with a high quality blade tempered to last longer through wear and tear.
items.name: モッコー・カタナ

items.description: A legendary sword with the edge forged on the reverse side of the blade. Considered to be a weapon of peace as it's not well suited for killing.
items.name: 逆刃刀

items.description: A legendary sword with the edge forged on the reverse side of the blade. Considered to be a weapon of peace as it's not well suited for killing.
items.name: 逆刃刀

items.description: A katana with a tsuba made to copy the design conceived by Miyamoto Musashi.
items.name: 武蔵の大刀

items.description: A katana with a tsuba made to copy the design conceived by Miyamoto Musashi.
items.name: 武蔵の大刀

items.description: An exceptional blade forged by master swordsmith Samonji, handed down through generations of Shoguns. Though the blade was forged as a tachi, the mounting and handle is that of a katana.
items.name: 江雪左文字

items.description: An exceptional blade forged by master swordsmith Samonji, handed down through generations of Shoguns. Though the blade was forged as a tachi, the mounting and handle is that of a katana.
items.name: 江雪左文字

items.description: A longer than average katana. While longer katanas were slightly more difficult to draw, they made up for it with reach.
items.name: 古大刀

items.description: A longer than average katana. While longer katanas were slightly more difficult to draw, they made up for it with reach.
items.name: 古大刀

items.description: Longer than a katana, it was worn blade downward to make drawing its curved blade easier, especially on horseback.
items.name: 千手院の太刀

items.description: Longer than a katana, it was worn blade downward to make drawing its curved blade easier, especially on horseback.
items.name: 千手院の太刀

items.description: The tachi was the predacessor to the katana, mostly used by horsemen as a backup weapon to their bow.
items.name: 大和の太刀

items.description: The tachi was the predacessor to the katana, mostly used by horsemen as a backup weapon to their bow.
items.name: 大和の太刀

items.description: A slim-bladed tachi without a signature, said to be given to Minamoto Yorimasa by the emperor for the slaying of a demon.
items.name: 獅子王

items.description: A slim-bladed tachi without a signature, said to be given to Minamoto Yorimasa by the emperor for the slaying of a demon.
items.name: 獅子王

items.description: A 1000 year old blade kept in perfect condition, forged by Sanjo Munechika and named after the crescent moon.
items.name: 三日月宗近

items.description: A 1000 year old blade kept in perfect condition, forged by Sanjo Munechika and named after the crescent moon.
items.name: 三日月宗近

items.description: Considered Japan's greatest sword, the life work of Yasutsuna - inventor of the katana. Named after a great demon the sword had slain.
items.name: 童子切安綱

items.description: Considered Japan's greatest sword, the life work of Yasutsuna - inventor of the katana. Named after a great demon the sword had slain.
items.name: 童子切安綱

items.description: With a strong curve in the blade, the tachi was ideal for downward strikes and use on horseback.
items.name: 備前の太刀

items.description: With a strong curve in the blade, the tachi was ideal for downward strikes and use on horseback.
items.name: 備前の太刀

items.description: A 'field sword' difficult to carry and mainly used on the battlefield. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 野太刀

items.description: A 'field sword' difficult to carry and mainly used on the battlefield. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 野太刀

items.description: A 'field sword' difficult to carry and mainly used on the battlefield. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 関の野太刀

items.description: A 'field sword' difficult to carry and mainly used on the battlefield. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 関の野太刀

items.description: A Japanese great sword. Being difficult to wield, many were offered to shrines. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 大太刀

items.description: A Japanese great sword. Being difficult to wield, many were offered to shrines. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 大太刀

items.description: A massive shrine sword belonging to Makara Naotaka, a samurai famed for his talent with the odachi.
items.name: 太郎太刀

items.description: A massive shrine sword belonging to Makara Naotaka, a samurai famed for his talent with the odachi.
items.name: 太郎太刀

items.description: A cross between a polearm and a sword, used in long sweeping strokes. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 長巻

items.description: A cross between a polearm and a sword, used in long sweeping strokes. The saya must be unequipped to draw it.
items.name: 長巻

items.description: A rare Korean greatsword used defensively by incredibly skilled soldiers. Notable for its very long grip.
items.name: サンスドー

items.description: A rare Korean greatsword used defensively by incredibly skilled soldiers. Notable for its very long grip.
items.name: サンスドー

items.description: A katana blade with the blacksmith's name etched into the tang. Not well suited for combat in this state.
items.name: 刀の刃

items.description: A stiff wooden sword fashioned directly in the proportions of a katana. While a safe training alternative, it can still be quite lethal.
items.name: 木刀

items.description: A light weight bamboo stick used in kendo. The string is meant to represent the edge alignment for proper strikes.
items.name: 竹刀
